title: encoding/json: internal cleanup of return values for encodeState.stringBytes and encodeState.string
body:
In [encode.go](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/da87cf5dcf342a31c82ff7980bdc076558ff6674/src/encoding/json/encode.go#L783), `type encodeState` has two methods, `stringBytes` and `string`, each of which return (int, error). In both cases, the only error that is returned from the methods is `nil`, and the int that is returned is never read:

* `_, err := e.stringBytes(...)` on lines [449](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/da87cf5dcf342a31c82ff7980bdc076558ff6674/src/encoding/json/encode.go#L449), [465](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/da87cf5dcf342a31c82ff7980bdc076558ff6674/src/encoding/json/encode.go#L465)
* `e.string(...)` on lines [544](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/da87cf5dcf342a31c82ff7980bdc076558ff6674/src/encoding/json/encode.go#L544), [546](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/da87cf5dcf342a31c82ff7980bdc076558ff6674/src/encoding/json/encode.go#L546), [580](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/da87cf5dcf342a31c82ff7980bdc076558ff6674/src/encoding/json/encode.go#L580), [615](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/da87cf5dcf342a31c82ff7980bdc076558ff6674/src/encoding/json/encode.go#L615)

Return values are similarly ignored in `encode_test.go`:

* `_, err := e.string(...)` on line [384](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/da87cf5dcf342a31c82ff7980bdc076558ff6674/src/encoding/json/encode_test.go#L384)
* `_, err := e.stringBytes(...)` on line [390](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/da87cf5dcf342a31c82ff7980bdc076558ff6674/src/encoding/json/encode_test.go#L390)

I believe these methods can simply return nothing without any change in functionality.
